The correspondence is organized into two sub-series, Business and Personal and arranged chronologically.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">In Rare Books and Manuscripts, University Libraries, Pennsylvania State University, University Park, Pa. (#1993-0002R).</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="506" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Unrestricted access.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="8" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">The collection contains Fiona Pitt-Kethley's manuscripts and drafts of her books and poems, and personal and business correspondence with her agent, Giles Gordon of Sheil Land Associates, and publishers Chatto & Windus, Peter Owen, and Sinclair-Stevenson, MacDonald & Co., among others. There is correspondence concerning her discrimination case against the Arts Council of Great Britain and her difficulties with Bloodaxe Books in getting her writings published. Most of her personal correspondence is greeting cards, Christmas cards, postcards, and a few letters. Includes manuscripts for Cure for impotence, Journeys to the underworld, Literary companion to sex, London, Maiden's progress, Misfortunes of Nigel, Perfect man, Private parts, Puppet master, Rome, Sex and suffering in Italy, Sky ray lolly, and Too hot to handle. Also includes her travel itineraries, artist show invitations, and items from the Arts Council of Great Britain.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="545" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Fiona all_text_timv: Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Fiona Pitt-Kethley literary papers, 1962-1993. 23 linear ft. Organized into three series: Manuscripts, Correspondence, and Miscellaneous Materials.  Manuscripts are arranged alphabetically by draft titles. The correspondence is organized into two sub-series, Business and Personal and arranged chronologically. In Rare Books and Manuscripts, University Libraries, Pennsylvania State University, University Park, Pa. (#1993-0002R). Unrestricted access. The collection contains Fiona Pitt-Kethley's manuscripts and drafts of her books and poems, and personal and business correspondence with her agent, Giles Gordon of Sheil Land Associates, and publishers Chatto & Windus, Peter Owen, and Sinclair-Stevenson, MacDonald & Co., among others. There is correspondence concerning her discrimination case against the Arts Council of Great Britain and her difficulties with Bloodaxe Books in getting her writings published. Most of her personal correspondence is greeting cards, Christmas cards, postcards, and a few letters. Includes manuscripts for Cure for impotence, Journeys to the underworld, Literary companion to sex, London, Maiden's progress, Misfortunes of Nigel, Perfect man, Private parts, Puppet master, Rome, Sex and suffering in Italy, Sky ray lolly, and Too hot to handle. Also includes her travel itineraries, artist show invitations, and items from the Arts Council of Great Britain. Fiona Pitt-Kethley, born in Middlesex, England, is a British writer of books and poems on sex and travel. English. Online EAD finding aid available at http://resources.libraries.psu.edu/findingaids/2457.htm Bloodaxe Books. Authors and publishers Great Britain. Erotic stories, English. Novelists, English Fiction. Poets, English Travel Italy 20th century. Reverse discrimination Great Britain. Voyages to the otherworld in literature. Italy Description and travel. Italy Antiquities. Correspondence. aat Manuscripts for publication. aat Novels. aat Poems. aat Postcards. aat Gordon, Giles, 1940-2003, correspondent. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Cure for impotence. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Journeys to the underworld. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Literary companion to sex. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- London. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Maiden's progress. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Misfortunes of Nigel. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Perfect man. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Private parts. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Puppet master. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Rome. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Sex and suffering in Italy. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Sky ray lolly. Pitt-Kethley, Fiona, 1954- Too hot to handle. Arts Council of Great Britain, correspondent. Chatto & Windus (Firm) correspondent. MacDonald & Co., correspondent. Peter Owen (Firm), correspondent. Sheil Land Associates, correspondent. Sinclair-Stevenson (Firm), correspondent. Online EAD finding aid http://resources.libraries.psu.edu/findingaids/2457.htm

There is correspondence concerning her discrimination case against the Arts Council of Great Britain and her difficulties with Bloodaxe Books in getting her writings published. Most of her personal correspondence is greeting cards, Christmas cards, postcards, and a few letters. Includes manuscripts for Cure for impotence, Journeys to the underworld, Literary companion to sex, London, Maiden's progress, Misfortunes of Nigel, Perfect man, Private parts, Puppet master, Rome, Sex and suffering in Italy, Sky ray lolly, and Too hot to handle. Also includes her travel itineraries, artist show invitations, and items from the Arts Council of Great Britain.
